snippet: The Turkish Foreign Ministry confirmed that 10 Turks were under arrest in China but did not say they had been helping terrorism suspects, as a Chinese report asserted.
abstract: Turkey confirms that 10 of its citizens are under arrest in China for trying to smuggle people out of the country; Turkish Foreign Ministry does not respond to allegations that they were aiding terrorism suspects.

byline.original: By EDWARD WONG and SEBNEM ARSU
byline.contributor: Edward Wong reported from Beijing, and Sebnem Arsu from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: The Turkish Foreign Ministry confirmed that 10 Turks were under arrest in China but did not say they had been helping terrorism suspects, as a Chinese report asserted.

headline.main: Turkey Casts Doubt on Chinese Account of Turks’ Arrests in Smuggling Plot
headline.print_headline: China: Turkey Confirms Arrests in Smuggling Case
